page.title: 10The Church, Yelden
page.content: Yelden Parish Church of St. Mary the Virgin is an example of the decorated style but little of it's 12th Century origins remain and it is now predominantly 14th Century. Like many of the churches throughout the country St. Mary's is in need of restoration. A minimum of Â£40,000 is required to prevent the Breach Tower from collapsing. A grant of 75% is being offered by the government for repairs and the additional money is being raised by the villagers holding events. One such event was a Barn Dance held at Rifle Range Farm in July which raised Â£370. Being 1 of the 6 Stodden Churches the vicar rotates the services on a6 weekly basis. Children are welcomed to the Family Communion. Ladies in the village take care of the cleaning and flower arrangements.
